contents.item: If you know the art of finding some things in a quite empty street, then you know the art of happiness!
contents.owner: Mehmet Murat ildan

contents.item: All beautiful distractions, ignites from you.
contents.owner: V.S. Atbay

contents.item: The artist's job is not to succumb to despair but to find an antidote for the emptiness of existence.
contents.owner: Woody Allen

contents.item: Hope and Memory have one daughter and her name is Art, and she has built her dwelling far from the desperate field where men hang out their garments upon forked boughs to be banners of battle. O beloved daughter of Hope and Memory, be with me for a while.
contents.owner: W.B. Yeats

contents.item: Fair as the moon and joyful as the light;Tot wan with waiting, not with sorrow dim; Not as she is, but was when hope shone bright;Not as she is, but as she fills his dreams.
contents.owner: Christina Rossetti

contents.item: I'm pretty much looking for beauty all the time. It just seems like some days the light is better to see it.
contents.owner: Melodie Ramone

contents.item: she was completely wholeand yet never fully complete
contents.owner: Maquita Donyel Irvin, Stories of a Polished Pistil: Lace and Ruffles

contents.item: Bad art has the power to deform a people just as good art generates new reflection, growth, vision, and hope.
contents.owner: Michel O'Brien

contents.item: In the future, as in the present, as in the past, black people will build many new worlds.This is true. I will make it so. And you will help me.
contents.owner: N.K. Jemisin

contents.item: But, luckily, he kept his wits and his purple crayon.
contents.owner: Crockett Johnson, Harold and the Purple Crayon

contents.item: I hope that someday when I am gone, someone, somewhere, picks my soul up off of these pages and thinks, "I would have loved her.
contents.owner: Nicole  Lyons

contents.item: ...unforgivingly, and forcefully magnificent...
contents.owner: Maquita Donyel Irvin

contents.item: There is a miracle in your mess, don't let the mess make you miss the miracle.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: It’s when your plans look dead that God’s resurrection power begins to operate in your life in greater measure
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: God is not interested in helping you finding out why you are in a mess, He is interested in fixing it.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: God always sees me with no make-ups on because He knew how we started.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: There must always be an opposition because the enemy always opposes what the Lord has declared.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: I would rather have a man chasing JESUS than a house full of stuffs and garrage filled with big cars.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: I am amazed upon the many battle that we engage in, be it money, control or matters of the heart, only very few of us knows how to fight in the right way or understand who we are really fighting against. To win any battle you' ve got to have the right strategy and resources because victories don't come by accident.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder

contents.item: All the failures in my life freed me from all my fears so that I can succeed.
contents.owner: Patience Johnson, Why Does an Orderly God Allow Disorder
